metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0075 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the parseChunkHeader function injava/org/apache/coyote/http11/filters/ChunkedInputFilter.java in ApacheTomcat before 6.0.40, 7.x before 7.0.53, and 8.x before 8.0.4 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption) via amalformed chunk size in chunked transfer coding of a request during thestreaming of data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0075` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.4-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
libtomcat6-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6 - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-admin - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-common - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-examples - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-extras - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-user - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1').
tomcat7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.1').
